titles.title: Hakkenden: Touhou Hakken Ibun
Hakkenden Eight Dogs of the East
八犬伝 -東方八犬異聞-
Hakkenden: Eight Dogs of the East
八犬传-东方八犬异闻-

anime.description: Five years ago, almost every villager of Ootsuka died due to a tragic plague. But mysteriously enough, three survivors: a girl and two boys, emerged. Now living in a church, the three live in isolation, hidden from those who may seek to find them. Shino, one of the survivors, has control over the power of Murasame, the blade of life. But when the imperial church seeks to take the Murasame for themselves, their peaceful life becomes a thing of the past...

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: immortality
tag.description: Immortality is the ability to live in a physical or spiritual form for an infinite or inconceivably vast length of time. Humans, whose life span is limited and who die of age, disease and external trauma, have long sought ways to extend their lives; the Epic of Gilgamesh, considered one of the first great literary works created by mankind, is primarily the quest of a hero seeking to become immortal. The advances of science, in particular medicine and engineering, and especially in the last few centuries, have helped people extend their life span and may yet continue finding ways to do so. In fiction, immortals are not quite as uncommon as in real life, and the possible implications of endless or very long lives are often explored. Such implications include, but are not limited to: repeatedly accompanying the deaths of those dear to them; having to hide their condition from the mortals surrounding them; becoming disillusioned with their lives and being unable to kill themselves; and even staying forever trapped in the body of a specific physical age, that body most often being that of a child. As such, while many may wish for immortality, it may be little more than a curse for the few who have it.

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: ghost
tag.description: In traditional belief, a ghost is the soul or spirit of a deceased person or animal that can appear, in visible form or other manifestation, to the living. Descriptions of the apparition of ghosts vary widely: The mode of manifestation can range from an invisible presence to translucent or wispy shapes, to realistic, life-like visions.

tag.name: deity
tag.description: Some religions say that there is a supernatural being called God. Other religions say there is more than one god. A supernatural being is also sometimes called a deity. Many religions believe that a deity created everything that exists. In most religions, a god is believed to be immortal (cannot die), and to have powers to control nature far beyond the powers of humans.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: school dormitory
tag.description: A school dormitory or residence hall is the student living quarters at an elite academy, boarding school, or military school. The main characters may live or work at the dormitory, and it often becomes the backdrop for a reoccurring part of the story.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen ai
tag.description: Shounen Ai means boys love, and thus explores what happens when two boys (or men) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2723 [Yaoi] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphical sex. The female version is http://anidb.net/t2782 [Shoujo Ai].

tag.name: reverse harem
tag.description: Reverse harem, or sometimes also male harem, is the common name for the gender-reversed version of the usual http://anidb.net/t2859 [harem genre]. In a reverse harem, instead of the usual situation with several female characters focused on one male character, the viewer sees several male characters surrounding a single female character. Aside from the swapping of the characters` genders, the trope`s details are mostly the same, with the majority of the changes relating to the differences in behavior between men and women of the characters` age range. The most notable exception is that, due to the most relevant characteristics of the trope`s fan base, reverse harem authors tend to go for http://anidb.net/t1760 [bishounen] looks. Though they are also exceptions to the common harem genre, harems with homosexual relationships are not covered by reverse harem.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: religion
tag.description: Religion is a collection of belief systems, cultural systems, and worldviews that relate humanity to spirituality and, sometimes, to moral values. Many religions have narratives, symbols, traditions and sacred histories that are intended to give meaning to life or to explain the origin of life or the universe. They tend to derive morality, ethics, religious laws or a preferred lifestyle from their ideas about the cosmos and human nature.

tag.name: revenge
tag.description: A primary factor that drives the plot forward, is the almost obsessive desire of one of the characters to get back at someone else.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: body sharing
tag.description: A character shares the same body with another entity. Usually this is due to a secret/hidden identity either due to DNA/blood, a ritual, an item or some freak accident. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t3663 [body snatcher].

tag.name: death is cheap
tag.description: Important characters will have a terrible tendency to die dramatically, but will not, under any circumstances, stay dead. This tends to cheapen the dramatic death of a character to the point of being little more than a flesh wound if overused. If you ever hear passing mention of any form of afterlife in a series, be warned that the value of "dead" has become a whole lot less all of a sudden. Similarly, if the entire supporting cast is being killed off left and right, expect a resurrection by the end of the current arc. This trope became so common in some series that most people are more likely to be shocked if a character does not come back from the dead than when it does.

tag.name: fate
tag.description: Fate — The predestined path of all things. The outcome is inevitable and the consequences predetermined. Whether or not the protagonist ultimately decides to follow this path shall weigh heavily on their soul.

tag.name: fighting
tag.description: For some reason or other one faction has to take it out on some opponent via fight or battle. Typical examples of this are all the anime with "endless pointless fighting" tag.

tag.name: multiple protagonists - TO BE MOVED TO PARENT OR DELETED
tag.description: This tag is to be moved into its parent tag http://anidb.net/t4251 [ensemble cast], or removed entirely. If the tagged entry meets the updated definition of ensemble cast, tag ensemble cast and delete multiple protagonist. If it does not meet the ensemble cast definition, delete this tag and take no further action.

tag.name: transforming guardian
tag.description: Guardian-like characters in this anime, e.g. Guardian Angels, will actually transform into another usually "powered up" version of themselves.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: trapped in the body of a child
tag.description: For some reason, a character in this anime who is a late-teenager or an adult, has their mind trapped in the body of a child. E.g. a former late teenager or an adult is transformed into a child. This can be the result of magic, science, or otherwise.

tag.name: the chosen one!
tag.description: One of the characters in the anime is the "chosen one", the one to bring about change, the only one to "set things right" in a "good" ending, or bring about complete destruction in a "bad" ending.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia]

tag.name: Japanese mythology
tag.description: Japanese mythology is a system of beliefs that embraces Shinto and Buddhist traditions as well as agriculture-based folk religion. The Shinto pantheon alone consists of an uncountable number of kami (Japanese for "gods" or "spirits"). (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: nearly almighty protagonist
tag.description: Man 1: "Hey man, did you see me take down that guy over there, there`s no way he could have survived that!" Man 2: "Yeah I know what you mean, it would take the strength of 1 million men to be able to ..... HE`S GETTING BACK UP!!?!?" *synonymous jaws dropping* This anime`s main character is comparable to the gods themselves in terms of resistibility, strength and/or downright bad-assery. Whenever they seem as if the fire inside has burnt out, they rise from the ashes with enough tenacity and ferocity to vanquish any foe that dare stand against them.

tag.name: massacre
tag.description: Mass murder.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: monster of the week
tag.description: On a pretty much regular basis — weekly or episodic — the protagonists engage in some kind of conflict. This can be an actual showdown between mecha, or the all-out fight against an enemy, or a (car) race that needs to be won. This can make the anime quite repetitive.

tag.name: power gives you wings
tag.description: It is not Red Bull that gives you wings, but power, most often even the power of love. Whether it`s an android, a mecha, mons, a mahou shoujo, or basically any super powered individual, once they start powering up and become REALLY powerful, it will be indicated by them getting a pair of wings. Specifically, feathery white angelic wings, sometimes also wings made of Hard Light or Pure Energy. These wings will of course allow the character to fly, float, and glow, all without needing to flap them!

tag.name: animal transforms into weapon
tag.description: A being that appears to be a normal animal, is actually something much more, for it can transform into a weapon.

tag.name: gotta catch them all
tag.description: A typical plot or sub-plot for many shows. Either the cast or somebody else, that being often the main antagonist, embarks on a quest to collect things, shiny things. Things that are said to grant simple wishes or even do miracles like bringing people back to life, destroying the whole world, galaxy, universe and in rare cases turning the hero into the greatest Pokemon Master. Those things can be weapons, lost technology, magical artefacts, pieces of a giant magical artefact and in some cases even people or little critters. The point is, there`s stuff to collect!

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: body and host
tag.description: When a foreign entity like that of a symbiote, body snatcher, puppeteer parasite, or even a hacker (when regarding machines like robots and computers) enters/outright hijacks a body, the possessed subject becomes what is usually called: the host. The basic purpose of the host varies on what the point was for it to have been hijacked in the first place. Sometimes it`s used as a disguise, other times it`s used as a decoy and destraction, even simply being used as a weapon and piece of armor that the possessor uses to cause sheer chaos and destruction, but sometimes... a host can be used for fetish fuel.

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: Hakkenden
tag.description: Nansou Satomi Hakkenden (The Tale of Eight Dogs) is a Japanese epic novel in 106 volumes written by Kyokutei Bakin over nearly 30 years in the first half of the 19th century.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Inuzuka Shino
character.description: Holder of the Devotion bead, Shino is one of three teenagers who survived the destruction of Ootsuka Village five years prior. He found himself near dying as his village burned, but chose life over death and now harbors the living spirit sword http://anidb.net/ch49445 [Murasame] in his arm. With Murasame comes the curse of not aging, which explains his looks. He has a birthmark in the shape of a peony flower on his right arm. He feels a special attachment to his childhood friends http://anidb.net/ch49443 [Sousuke] and http://anidb.net/ch49444 [Hamaji], the other two survivors of Ootsuka Village.

character.name: Inukawa Sousuke
character.description: Sousuke is one of the three children who survived the destruction of Ootsuka village 5 years prior. He did not have relatives and thus was raised with http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino] and http://anidb.net/ch49444 [Hamaji], the other two survivors, as if they were siblings. He has a peony-shaped birthmark on the back of his neck. Ever since the accident he has an ability to transform into the dog Yoshiro, who makes up half of himself. His real other half is manifested in Ao, his shadow, causing Sousuke`s memories and body parts to be split between the two. This causes Sousuke to not remember everything from his past, as well as slowly losing the ability to feel pain, and the sight in his left eye. He is the holder of the Duty bead.

character.name: Hamaji
character.description: Hamaji is like a sister to http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino] and http://anidb.net/ch49443 [Sousuke], having been raised with them since childhood. Along with them, she survived the destruction of Otsuka Village. She is something of a health nut, and obsessed with making sure everyone around her maintains a proper diet, but her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired. Unlike her pretty appearance, she often manipulates Shino and Sousuke, but in heart, she cares about them. Source: ANN

character.name: Murasame
character.description: Murasame is a living spirit sword rumored to hold sway over all things without shape or form, but it is said that whomever the sword possesses will meet a violent and tragic end. The blade ordinarily takes the form of a crow and speaks in human language, concealing itself on http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino]`s right arm when resting. Murasame sometimes picks and eats food that somebody dropped, and Shino scolds Murasame for the behavior. Source: ANN

character.name: Inukai Genpachi
character.description: Genpachi is a captain of the imperial military police. One day he went on an assignment, accompanied by his soon-to-be brother-in-law http://anidb.net/ch50984 [Kobungo] into the north three years priors just to returned as a demon, who is hungry for spirits. He was supposed to marry Kobungo`s sister Nui, but upon their arrival, they had to find she has committed suicide. It was said that she carried the child of another man, whom she couldn`t identify, and due to having been received the news of her fiancées soon return, she couldn`t take it anymore. Genpachi is often seen sparkling when looking at people who fit his type. He prays on Shino and hopes he will grow up soon. He is the holder of the Faith bead.

character.name: Inuta Kobungo
character.description: Kobungo`s family runs the Konaya bed-and-breakfast inn, and Kobungo himself is excellent at caring for people`s needs. Three years prior, he volunteered as a foot soldier and accompanied the soon to be husband of his sister, http://anidb.net/ch50983 [Genpachi], in an army deployment sent to contain an incident taking place in a remote northern village. There the whole squad has been killed by man-eating demons. Since then he is able to change into a demon himself. He is the holder of the Brotherhood bead.

character.name: Inuyama Dousetsu
character.description: After dying in snow, Yuki Hime brought him back and is from now always by his side - both protecting him from evil and women. He comes from a family of physicians and says the colour of his hair is this weird because of his lineage and the early onset immunity to certain medicines/drugs. From that time he remembers a younger sister, Mutsuki, whom he is searching for since his death, carrying a hairpin with him that she once slipped into his pocket before being separated. He is the holder of the Loyalty bead.

character.name: Inusaka Keno
character.description: Travelling with the music group, he is looking to take revenge on the one who `took everything from him` two years prior. This man also happened to carve his heart out, yet Keno refused to die. Kokonoe, the demon princess, was very fond of that behaviour, so she brought him back and since then is travelling with him. Due to his extreme beautiful looks he gets mistaken for a woman more than just once. He`s the holder of the Wisdom bead.

character.name: Satomi Riou
character.description: Member of the Four Houses, and, according to Shino, the one who saved the three from Ootsuka Village five years prior.

character.name: Osaki Kaname
character.description: One of the members of the Four Houses. His beasts consist of five foxes who act as servants to the inhabitants of the mansion the members live in. Like so many others before him, he was cast out of his family for being a "disgrace" after having been chosen by the fox spirits.

character.name: Mizuki Ayane
character.description: Ayane was born into the Mizuki family without any colouring. As an albino she has been taken care of by Chikage, a snake deity and protector of the Mizuki`s land - because she`s just the same as him. Ayane is being overly protected by Chikage, who actually only tries to fulfil her desires. She is the last living member of the Mizuki family.

character.name: Megu
character.description: One-eyed monster which has the appearance of a black sphere.

character.name: Yatsufusa
character.description: Yatsufusa is a giant dog that is part of the Four Houses. It is said that he normally choses a female, yet chose Satomi Riou in this life. This might be explained by Rious most beautiful looks.

character.name: Seiran
character.description: Monk

character.name: Kokonoe
character.description: Princess Yasha.

character.name: Yukihime
character.description: A Snow Princess and a friend of Shino. Once lost in the snowy forest, she helped Shino find his way home. She is known to sing beautiful songs that almost sound like lullabies. For saving Inuyama Dousetsu`s life, she had to sacrifice her voice.

character.name: Chikage
character.description: Chikage is the beast of Ayane. She sometimes appears in the shape of a human. Unlike the other beasts, Chikage has grown too large to leave the mansion, also limiting Ayane`s capability of traveling. As Chikage is very protective of Ayane due to her health, she needs some time to be persuaded by Shino to have the foxes accompany her outside.

character.name: Kohaku
character.description: A prostitute with outstandimg golden (or amber (kohaku)) eyes. For she is terminally sick, she exchanged one of her eyes for a "life of one week" with Ao. Her other eye shall fall into his posession upon her death.

character.name: Inuta Bungobee
character.description: Father of Inuta Kobungo.

character.name: Inuta Sayoko
character.description: Mother of Inuta Kobungo, and innkeeper.

character.name: Ao
character.description: A mysterious figure who looks just like Inukawa Sousuke. It is explained that this is due to the fact that at the incident five years prior Sousuke`s soul was split into two halfes. He can pretty much be compared to an "evil twin".

character.name: Raiki
character.description: Thunder demon.

character.name: Fuuki
character.description: Wind demon.

character.name: Fenegan
character.description: An elite member of the church.

character.name: Lilith
character.description: The guardian spirit of the church`s building. Strong, beautiful, and feared.

character.name: Kobayakawa Ruri
character.description: Prefect at the all-girl school that Hamaji goes to.

character.name: Saiki Akane
character.description: The village doctor.

character.name: Shouichi
character.description: Shouichi is the son of the brothel`s owner where Kohaku works.

character.name: Sakuraba Jouji
character.description: Now a medical examiner, Sakuraba Jouji (or George) is an old aquaintance of Inuta Kobungo and Inukai Genpachi from military times.

character.name: Kumagai Suzu
character.description: Hamaji`s roommate at the all-girls-dorm.

character.name: Sarugami
character.description: The giant monkey spirit/deity of the mountain.

character.name: Tamazusa
character.description: A mysterious nun working together with Sousuke`s shadow Ao. She is trying to prevent Satomi from collecting all 8 beads. Her existence is explained in a legend. She came to the country from a foreign land together with her two young sons. The government wasn`t too happy about that and forced her to give up one of them to the officials. She eventually decided to give up her youngest, whom was also very sickly at this time, so he had a chance of survival. They took him away and killed him. When the older son learned of that, he commited suicide. She was left devestated. Later on it is found out that she is the woman everybody is looking for.

character.name: Chudai
character.description: An exorcist that is riding on the same train. He is looking for evil spirits to get rid of them.

character.name: Usakuma
character.description: The guardian spirit of the all-girls school. Once seen by Shino, he is being made fun of for being scared by a big "stuffed animal".

character.name: Rou Sister
character.description: This character is actually present as two elderly sisters (nuns). They look the same, and they sound the same.

character.name: Kinko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 金 on the back.

character.name: Gingitsune
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 銀 on the back.

character.name: Kuroko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 黒 on the back.

character.name: Tenko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 天 on the back.

character.name: Byakko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 白 on the back.

character.name: Inuzuka Shino
character.description: Since his normal form is being trapped in the body of his 13-year old self, this Shino came out after a tragic incident, showing him how he would actually look like.

character.name: Yon Shishi Jinka
character.description: There are four Houses, the animals of those houses being the fox, the wolf, the snake, and the cat (or panther in this case), called the Four Sacred Beast Houses. The wielders of the Sacred Beasts are very powerful and tend to be feared, which is why the Church chose to take them in; so that they could control them. The wielders also tend to be ostracized by their families, even being called disgraces for some reason, so they are usually alone except for each other. The members are chosen by the beasts before their birth, and protect them from then on. They all live together in a huge mansion.

character.name: Hakkenshi
character.description: It is said that when the 8 holders of the beads granted to them by Princes Fuse in their prior life come together again, she will be revived and fullfil their wishes. All members carry the same birthmark, a peony, and were born with one of the beads.

episode.title: 境界
Borders
Kyoukai
episode.summary: Five years ago a village was burned to the ground, only three children survived. Now, as they live in peace outside a new city, it seems that a powerful organization has come looking for them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人鬼
Humans and Demons
Hito Oni
episode.summary: While Hamaji makes demands of her kidnapper, Shino and Sosuke visit the city and get a warm greeting from the Church. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 代償
Compensation
Daishou
episode.summary: The curse, being temporary lifted, has caused Shino to revert to his real age. His excitement is short lived as he must deal with Kohaku. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 現身
True Self
Utsusemi
episode.summary: After being shot, Murasame is released and feeds causing the demon to want more, more blood. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 孤影
A Lonely Figure
Koei
episode.summary: A man that resembles Sosuke has been spotted in the Imperial Capital; this has Keno up in racing around the city to exact his revenge. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 番人
Guard
Bannin
episode.summary: Hamaji has decided to enter an all-girls school and has told Shino to deliver her books to her. When he arrives at the campus he is met with the unofficial campus guard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 邂逅
Encounter
Kaikou
episode.summary: On the train ride home Shino meets an old friend to the surprise of Sosuke. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束
A Promise
Yakusoku
episode.summary: The villagers have discovered the gold the monkey god gave Shino and has forced him and his friends to take them up the mountain. That forces Akane to make return to the mountain where she spent her childhood. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 外持
Stashed
Homachi
episode.summary: A tale of a mountain that always rain, a man eating monkey god, and a woman who will show travelers the way. These stories have lead Shino to take a dangerous trip. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 加護
Divine Blessings
Kago
episode.summary: On the day of the new moon, Sosuke must sleep and even Murasame has to rest. This leaves Shino vulnerable to the mansions other residents. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 帰郷
Homecoming
Kikyou
episode.summary: After the fight with the monks Sosuke is injured, they are once again taken in by Kobungo who is shares his and Genpachi immortal story. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鬼追
The Approaching Demon
Onioi
episode.summary: Hamaji receives an offer that might keep her in the Imperial Capital. Shino and Sosuke sit down with Satomi to get the real reason why they were summoned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宿縁
Karma
Shukuen
episode.summary: The Church is forcing Satomi to bring Shino before the Elders. To make matters worse, the man that looks like Sosuke shared with Shino some devastating secrets. Source: crunchyroll
